Strictly speaking there are no cheats codes in KSP.

Alt+F12 will bring up the debug menu yes, allowing shortcuts like infinite fuel and infinite RCS.

The other way to mess with KSP is modding. There's mods to just about everything people have figured out how to implement in KSP, and all of the parts are defined by plain text config files- you can customize them further.

For instance if you want a really strong engine, make a copy of a stock one's parts folder and edit its config file to give it 10x the normal thrust.

Stuff like that is really easy to do if you just want to mess around instead of flying for real.

Most people mean cheat-codes or debug features when they refer to cheats saying "cheats", but if you are willing to step a bit out of those boundaries, there is also CheatEngine (hereafter "CE").

Using CE is stepping into hacking, and although it's not as easy as entering a cheat-code on the game's console or activating a built-in debug feature, it's not limited to the built-in cheat behavior either!

For example: KSP's debug menu only has options for infinite Fuel and RCS, but what if you want infinite Kethane? Easy! Open CE, target KSP process, find the "Kethane_amount" value (/memory address), and lock it!
